intro: Macrolenes bruneiensis, commonly known as the Brunei macrolepis, is a rare flowering plant native to the rainforests of Brunei. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and a distinct midrib. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
